Comments_List: Evaluating and analysing art, writing a history of art paper, knowledge about British landscape art history and about the four big British landscape artists
How to do art research, art critique, and how to look and appreciate art in general.

I have learnt so much about the prominent game-changers in British art, along with their foreign influences, from the 17th to 19th Century. This art history course is very engaging as it helped me see each artists' works and their significance in relation to the surrounding context.

Great field trips around London to museums and the greater British area. Good balance of lecture material and actually looking at art. Only improvement I would make would be better preparation for the final exam.

Strengths: A lot of exciting information. Opportunity to visit many wonderful locations where the artists themselves visited and painted. Extremely well-organized syllabus. 

Weakness: Very lecture-heavy. Some seminar discussions might have been fruitiful.
Yes! It is an incredibly engaging course that widened my knowledge and stirred my interest in a genre I always had trouble appreciating.
